page.title: 05VANDALISM. NEWPORT.
page.content: Ringland is a large council house estate built on the eastern boundary of Newport. Many people live there in a large variety of houses. There are 3 and 4 bedroomed houses, some detached and some in terraces. There are also maisonettes and flats, some of which are in multi-storey tower blocks. According to a survey, most children think that the estate is vandalised. This takes many forms, all of which do nothing to improve the appearance of the area. Paint has been sprayed onto walls, windows in bus shelters smashed, telephone boxes damaged. Some supermarkets have replaced glass windows with plywood. People are very worried about this problem, but it is only ordinary people like us who can help prevent it.
